page.title: 08FARMS AND FARMING
page.content: There are 3{farms}in this area, excluding Sarum Farm.This closed down because of the fuel crisis, when the Israel/Arab war started in the 1970's. The price of oil shot up,so they couldn't afford to buy it. Crab Wood,Lainston and Barton Farms are all {arable.} Barton Farm is owned by Winchester College. Each year,the farm produces about 600 tons of cereal and grass.The tenant farmer owns one drill fertilizer, combine, auger, fork lift, 3 tractors, 4 cultivators.Twice weekly the{cattle market}is held. The breeds include Hereford Cross, Friesian and Jersey. In 1984 they handled 3319 cattle,selling for about 95p for a kg. Dean Horse Livery is in our area. It was once like Barton Farm, growing crops. Reduced EEC quotas and lower demand for red meat has badly affected some farms.
